item.title: Seismic evidence for alternative (D-type) olivine fabric in fast-spreading lithosphere
Surface-wave constraints on upper mantle petrofabric and flow beneath ~40 Ma seafloor in the south Pacific
Surface-wave anisotropy of the Eastern North American Margin (ENAM)
High-Resolution Constraints on Pacific Upper Mantle Petrofabric Inferred From Surface-Wave Anisotropy
Pathways Into Geophysics and Seismology
item.description: In recent years, an effort has been made to broaden the geosciences both in terms of the number of underrepresented minorities as well as students with backgrounds in math, physics, and computer science. As an alumnus of the IRIS and UNAVCO RESESS emersive undergraduate research programs, I serve as one of the 2018 IRIS recruitment speakers as part of the IRIS Recruitment Lecture Series. In this role, I travel to minority-serving institutions to speak to undergraduates in the geosciences, mathematics, physics, and computer science about geophysics and seismology career paths as well as opportunities that are available for undergraduate research.

item.title: Comprehensive in situ constraints on LPO fabric of fast-spreading oceanic lithosphere from seismic anisotropy
